title: 2 U.S. Soldiers Are Killed at Afghan-NATO Base
title_page: 2 U.S. Soldiers Are Killed at Afghan-NATO Base - The New York Times
maintext:
KABUL, Afghanistan â€” Two more United States soldiers were killed in southern Afghanistan on Thursday when an Afghan soldier, apparently in league with a civilian, killed an Afghan tower guard and attacked a barracks with gunfire and a rocket, officials said.
Four American soldiers were shot dead last week, including two at the Afghan Interior Ministry, after the burning of copies of the Koran at a NATO base in Afghanistan set off protests across the country.
The attack on Thursday took place at a joint Afghan-NATO base in the Zhare district in Kandahar Province. Four other Americans were wounded in the attack, which began around 2:30 a.m. local time.
The two men who mounted the assault fled afterward, but American forces called helicopters to pursue them. Masoom Khan, the district chief of police, said that the two were killed by helicopter gunfire more than a mile from the scene of the attack.
